intro: Catunaregam nilotica, commonly known as the African breadfruit or wild breadfruit, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and smooth, grey bark. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits that contain numerous edible seeds. The seeds are rich in nutrients and have been traditionally used as a food source in various parts of Africa. Additionally, the plant has medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine for its antifungal and anti-inflammatory effects.
